Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Founded in 1913 in Italy, the Prada Group was built on a tradition of excellence and with a vision of innovation. Our Iconic Brands include PRADA, Miu Miu, Church’s, Car Shoe and Pasticceria Marchesi and we are currently operating in more than 45 Countries, embracing employees of more than 100 nationalities.

Joining our Company means working in a creative and international environment, with teams of people motivated by curiosity and the quest for excellence. The engine of our success is the importance and value that we place on the talent and passion of our people leading to their own professional growth.

Job Purpose

Prada Group is seeking a driven and passionate Data Science Intern to join our Data Analytics team within the IT department. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience with real-world datasets and advanced technologies in a dynamic, international luxury fashion environment. As a Data Science Intern, you will play a key role in enhancing our personalization capabilities and optimizing marketing campaigns that impact how we connect with our customers globally.

Responsibilities


Design, implement, and refine machine learning models to optimize both one-to-one and one-to-many marketing communication strategies.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into technical solutions.
Manage and analyze large datasets using cloud platforms such as Databricks.
Develop test, and deploy scalable machine learning algorithms using Python and PySpark.
Contribute to ongoing improvement of data processes, methodologies, and best practices within the team.


Knowledge And Skills

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.

Proficiency in Python and familiarity with PySpark.

Exposure to cloud-based analytics environments - experience with Databricks or similar platform is a plus.

Experience using data visualization tools such as Power BI is advantageous.

Analytical and problem-solving skills, with a detail-oriented approach.

Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.

Willingness to learn, adapt, and grow within a fast-paced, innovative setting.

Organized, with strong time management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Area Products & Services
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

Inserito all'interno della Unit Business Intelligence – appartenente all'Area Global Business,

la risorsa da noi ricercata si occuperà di fornire supporto analitico con particolare focus sull’area Brokerage.

In questo ambito si occuperà di analisi relative allo sviluppo di nuovi prodotti e al monitoraggio del portafoglio prodotti esistenti. Le analisi riguardano i prodotti da tutti i punti di vista: dalla Customer Base, al Pricing, alla Redditività.

Dovrà possedere doti di precisione e autonomia, partendo dalla comprensione del problema di business, fino all’estrazione dei dati e alla presentazione dei risultati.

Considerata la centralità del ruolo all’interno del processo di sviluppo prodotti, la risorsa dovrà essere in grado di comunicare con colleghi delle diverse aree della Banca: dal Business, al Risk management, dal Finance all’IT:

Attività


Effettuare analisi in autonomia, dalla fase di estrazione dati alla presentazione dei risultati
Produrre report automatizzati utilizzando tool di Business Intelligence
Costruire modelli predittivi al fine di ottimizzare le azioni di marketing



Requirements

Requisiti


Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale, Statistica o Matematica
Forte interesse per la finanza, il trading e gli investimenti
Esperienza fino a 3 anni in ruoli analoghi
Eccellenti abilità analitiche e quantitative
Dimostrato interesse per Machine Learning e le analisi di marketing
Buone capacità di interpretazione e di comunicazione dei risultati
Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione (R, Python, Matlab)
Conoscenza di SQL o database relazionali
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e PowerPoint



Verranno Considerati Un Plus


Conoscenza di applicativi di Business Intelligence
Conoscenza di cluster analysis, modelli di regressione e classificazione, alberi decisionali



Completano il profilo l’entusiasmo e la proattività nel cercare e proporre soluzioni, capacità di lavorare sotto pressione, attitudine al team working e doti relazionali.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”
Show more

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
[In order to requisition 1968]

Join Our Generative AI Technical Group at Tweag the OSPO of Modus Create!

We are looking for an AI Engineer to join our Generative AI technical group, where we combine engineering agility with deep expertise and a scientific approach to advance the state of how AI is used, provide actionable practical insights, and establish best practices in the field.

About You

Previously, you worked as an AI engineer, data engineer or software developer, with a couple of AI or data-centric projects under the hood. Perhaps you have been relying on previous academic experience in a quantitative field for autonomous, deep-dive work for that, but no matter how, you absorb quickly and enthusiastically. Since The Hype started, you have successfully designed and implemented applications using Generative AI.

Now that you know how to build stuff, you realized that there are wrong turns commonly taken in the community, whether imposed by tooling or by culture. As an engineer, you want to make the AI world a better place for not only developers, but also maintainers, product owners, and end users.

If you recognize yourself in parts of the above, the Generative AI group at Tweag, the OSPO of Modus Create, wants you to help us advance the way how AI technologies are used in the field. By building well-written open source tools and libraries, freely and happily sharing knowledge internally, on our technical blog, and during conferences, and consulting clients on how to build better with AI, you and the whole team can make a real difference: let's look behind all the buzz and make sure things are done right™!

Technologies and Tools


Python programming language and its popular numeric and data frameworks
Familiarity with an LLM framework (e.g. LangChain) and evaluation libraries
Cloud AI services: experience with some of SageMaker, Bedrock, Rekognition, etc. or equivalents on other platforms
Data storage and querying: SQL and NoSQL databases


Bonus points for


Comfortable with Git, GitHub/GitLab and CI/CD
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with other languages like Java, Scala, Rust, or R
Knowledge of cloud architecture, DevOps, or front-end development
Experience with processing / orchestration tools such as Airflow, Spark, Kafka, Nextflow, etc.
Contributions to open source projects
Academic background


Team Culture:

At Modus, a fast-growing, remote-first company, you'll experience various exciting projects! Here's a taste of what you might do:


Giving back: Be an active participant through opportunities such as blog posts, open source contributions, and event speaking.
Travel & connections: Meet fantastic people during our remote meet-ups! It's all about collaboration and fun! Global environment and diversity at its best.
Teaching and learning: Work in active teams on internal and external projects, staying up-to-date with the latest technologies.
Being a self starter: Autonomy and proactivity are the key to succeed at Modus.
Client interaction: Represent Modus and our values while connecting directly with our clients, some of the world's biggest brands.
Growth: Enjoy comprehensive learning benefits, with access to over 12,000 courses. Your growth is our priority!


About us:

Founded in 2011, Modus is a global, fully remote team of world-class technologists who thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment. We were fully remote before it was cool! We support organizations on their digital transformation journey through strategic consulting and full lifecycle product development, partnering with industry leaders including Atlassian, GitHub and AWS. Recognized as one of the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies for nine years and a top remote work company by FlexJobs, we have helped some of the world's largest brands deliver powerful digital experiences.

We combine boutique expertise with enterprise-scale capabilities. As an award-winning Atlassian partner with a world-class team, we help organizations innovate and solve complex challenges for Fortune 500 companies and beyond, we want to hear from you.

Perks of working with us:


Remote work with flexible working hours
Modus Global Office Programme:for when you want to get out of your home, we offer on-demand access to private offices, meeting rooms, coworking spaces and business lounges in locations in over 120 countries.
Employee Referral Program
Client Referral Program
Travel according to client or team needs
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
Access to more than 12,000 courses with a licensed Coursera account.
Possibility to obtain paid certification/courses if they align with company goals and are relevant to the employee's role


By joining our team, you'll be part of a winning squad that plays to each other's strengths and celebrates every success together. Apply now and show us you've got what it takes to take your consulting skills to the next level with Modus Create!
Show more

  • Remote work with flexible working hours
  • Modus Global Office Programme:for when you want to get out of your home, we offer on-demand access to private offices, meeting rooms, coworking spaces and business lounges in locations in over 120 countries.
  • Employee Referral Program
  • Client Referral Program
  • Travel according to client or team needs
  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
  • Access to more than 12,000 courses with a licensed Coursera account.
  • Possibility to obtain paid certification/courses if they align with company goals and are relevant to the employee's role

By joining our team, you'll be part of a winning squad that plays to each other's strengths and celebrates every success together. Apply now and show us you've got what it takes to take your consulting skills to the next level with Modus Create!

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Mid/Senior Data Scientist




Location: Remote

Contract Type: 12-Month Contract (Extendable)

Type: Full-time, Contract




The Role

Our client is looking for a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist / ML Engineer to lead the development and deployment of advanced machine learning models.




This is a 100% remote position on a 12-month extendable contract, offering flexibility and the opportunity to work with a global team.




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement AI agent-based architectures for intelligent automation in financial services.
Develop, train, and fine-tune LLMs and other ML models for production-grade performance.
Apply advanced statistical and mathematical modeling to improve predictive accuracy and financial decision-making.
Leverage market and behavioral data to drive innovation in ML applications.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate ML solutions into the platform.
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for structured and unstructured data.
Ensure ML systems are efficient, interpretable, and aligned with ethical and regulatory standards.




Requirements

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
3–5 years of hands-on experience in data science or ML engineering, preferably in fintech or financial services.
Proven experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT, LLaMA) and their deployment in production environments.
Familiarity with AI agents and autonomous systems is a strong plus.
Solid foundation in statistics, optimization, and numerical methods.
Proficiency in Python and ML libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, and Scikit-Learn.
Knowledge of financial modeling and portfolio optimization is a bonus.
Excellent communication skills in English (Arabic is a plus).




Why Join Us?

Work with cutting-edge AI/ML technologies in a high-impact role.
100% remote work with flexible hours.
Competitive compensation on a contract basis.
Opportunity for contract extension and long-term collaboration.

Show more

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:


Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.


Qualifications


BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).


If you’re excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that NOT all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‘art of the possible’.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team’s solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team’s velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations
Show more

  • Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
  • Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
  • Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
  • Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
  • Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
  • A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
  • Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
  • Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations

Title: Consultor / Cientista de Dados
Description:
A SulAmérica há mais de 129 anos se dedica a entregar Saúde Integral para mais de 7 milhões de clientes por meio de produtos e serviços de Saúde, Odonto, Vida, Previdência e Investimentos. Temos como missão melhorar a vida das pessoas, oferecendo apoio, segurança e autonomia em cada momento e decisão de saúde física, emocional e financeira. Para isso, contamos com mais de 4 mil colaboradores(as) engajados(as) e comprometidos(as).Acreditamos que por meio da inclusão e da diversidade construímos um ambiente seguro e de pertencimento que valoriza e respeita as pessoas integralmente. Assim, incentivamos a candidatura de pessoas com deficiência, de diferentes raças e etnias, gêneros, orientações sexuais, identidades de gênero e gerações para todas as nossas vagas.




Principais responsabilidades da vaga:

Centralizar todos os dados e analises da Diretoria, desde as ingestões de dados em ambientes produtivos e, principalmente estudos e geração de insights para tomadas de decisão.




Pré requisitos:

Fluência em SQL,
Ferramentas de visualização de dados
Python ou programação R são imprescindíveis
Experiência com técnicas de modelagem, como modelos de classificação, séries temporais, análise de sobrevivência, cluster, etc.
Superior completo
Conhecimento profundo estatística (modelagem)
Desafio: Manter-se à frente da construção de subsídios para embasamento da estratégia de gestão da diretoria, adaptando-se e aprimorando constantemente as abordagens, algoritmos e modelos para garantir pleno andamento das ações




Desejável:

Experiência com o mercado de Saúde;
LLM;




Modelo de trabalho:

Atuação 3 vezes por semana na região da Avenida Paulista e 2 dias remoto.

O que a SulA vai te proporcionar?

Além de um ambiente de inovação e aberto a experimentação:
Salário competitivo com o mercado;
Vale Refeição e Alimentação - para matar aquela fome;
Assistência Média e Odontológica (extensível a dependentes) - Claro, da SulAmérica né!
Seguro de vida;
Auxílio Creche para papais e mamães;
Previdência Privada com uma ajudinha da SulA;
Seguro de Vida.
A SulAmérica é uma empresa em transformação, com DNA inovador e sempre preocupada em atender as necessidades dos seus clientes com soluções e produtos encantadores. Se identificou? Então vem com a gente e fazer parte desse time #sanguelaranja 🧡🚀

Title: Data Scientist I
Description:
Sobre o Bradesco

O Bradesco é um dos maiores grupos financeiros do Brasil, com uma história marcada pelo pioneirismo e inovação. Por meio da nossa carteira amplamente diversificada de produtos financeiros, serviços bancários e de seguros contribuímos com a realização das pessoas e o crescimento sustentável de empresas e sociedade. Venha fazer parte do nosso ecossistema financeiro e impactar a experiência de milhões de pessoas!

Saiba mais em https://banco.bradesco/html/classic/sobre/index.shtm

Responsabilidades e atribuições

O que é o nosso time de Segurança Corporativa?

A área de Modelagem, somos protagonistas na jornada de dados à decisão. Atuamos em parceria com as áreas de negócio para identificar desafios e oportunidades, utilizar técnicas avançadas de ciência de dados e ferramentas best-in-class para entregar algoritmos de ML, regras inteligentes e estudos analíticos, com foco em experiência do cliente, mitigação de riscos e eficiência operacional. Planejamos, desenvolvemos, implantamos, sustentamos, monitoramos e governamos soluções de IA aplicadas a Prevenção a Fraudes, PLDFT e Segurança Física. Aqui, dados se transformam em inteligência — e inteligência em ação.

Modelo de trabalho :Hibrido - 2x presencial

Unidade: Osasco e Curitiba

Como será seu dia a dia?

Sendo Data Scientist I, atuará na gerência Segurança Corporativa e suas principais atividades serão:



Atuar em conjunto com as áreas de negócios identificando problemas e propondo soluções de IA envolvendo modelos preditivos, modelos decisórios, regras e estudos;
Utilizar plataformas de Big Data, metodologias estatísticas e de Machine Learning e linguagens de programação como Python, SQL e SAS para desenvolver algoritmos, testar soluções externas, ou realizar estudos pontuais para apoio à tomada de decisão;
Monitorar indicadores de desempenho dos modelos em produção, identificando e diagnosticando desvios, e elaborando planos de ação para eventuais correções;
Atuar em conjunto com clientes internos, parcerias estratégicas e fornecedores para estabelecer relações eficazes, refinar demandas de desenvolvimento e garantir condução adequada dos planos de ação.



Requisitos e Qualificações

O que você precisa ter ou saber?



Superior completo em Estatística, Matemática, Física, Engenharia ou áreas relacionadas
Experiência anterior com monitoramento de modelos;
Conhecimento de Estatística e Machine Learning;
Conhecimento de ferramentas de visualização;
Conhecimento de SQL e Python;
Desejável conhecimento de Databricks, PySpark e SAS.



Será um diferencial se você tiver:



Inglês Intermediário para conversação;
Conhecimento em Databricks e python;



O que nós oferecemos

No Bradesco valorizamos a saúde e bem-estar, oferecendo um extenso portfólio de benefícios a todas nossas pessoas funcionárias:



PLR ou Bônus: Conforme a elegibilidade de cargo*
Convênio Médico
Convênio Odontológico
Seguro de Vida
Vale Alimentação
Vale Refeição
13º Cesta Alimentação
Total Pass
Vale Transporte (adesão opcional)
Descontos em produtos e serviços em empresas parceiras
Previdência Privada (adesão opcional, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco)
Viva Bem Bradesco: programa de saúde, bem-estar e qualidade de vida
Unibrad: Universidade Corporativa Bradesco
Isenção de Tarifas: condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços
Auxílio Creche ou Babá
Licença Paternidade estendida de 20 dias
Licença Maternidade de 180 dias, acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto
Show more

Como será seu dia a dia?

Sendo Data Scientist I, atuará na gerência Segurança Corporativa e suas principais atividades serão:


  • Atuar em conjunto com as áreas de negócios identificando problemas e propondo soluções de IA envolvendo modelos preditivos, modelos decisórios, regras e estudos;
  • Utilizar plataformas de Big Data, metodologias estatísticas e de Machine Learning e linguagens de programação como Python, SQL e SAS para desenvolver algoritmos, testar soluções externas, ou realizar estudos pontuais para apoio à tomada de decisão;
  • Monitorar indicadores de desempenho dos modelos em produção, identificando e diagnosticando desvios, e elaborando planos de ação para eventuais correções;
  • Atuar em conjunto com clientes internos, parcerias estratégicas e fornecedores para estabelecer relações eficazes, refinar demandas de desenvolvimento e garantir condução adequada dos planos de ação.


Requisitos e Qualificações

O que você precisa ter ou saber?


  • Superior completo em Estatística, Matemática, Física, Engenharia ou áreas relacionadas
  • Experiência anterior com monitoramento de modelos;
  • Conhecimento de Estatística e Machine Learning;
  • Conhecimento de ferramentas de visualização;
  • Conhecimento de SQL e Python;
  • Desejável conhecimento de Databricks, PySpark e SAS.


Será um diferencial se você tiver:


  • Inglês Intermediário para conversação;
  • Conhecimento em Databricks e python;


O que nós oferecemos

No Bradesco valorizamos a saúde e bem-estar, oferecendo um extenso portfólio de benefícios a todas nossas pessoas funcionárias:


  • PLR ou Bônus: Conforme a elegibilidade de cargo*
  • Convênio Médico
  • Convênio Odontológico
  • Seguro de Vida
  • Vale Alimentação
  • Vale Refeição
  • 13º Cesta Alimentação
  • Total Pass
  • Vale Transporte (adesão opcional)
  • Descontos em produtos e serviços em empresas parceiras
  • Previdência Privada (adesão opcional, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco)
  • Viva Bem Bradesco: programa de saúde, bem-estar e qualidade de vida
  • Unibrad: Universidade Corporativa Bradesco
  • Isenção de Tarifas: condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços
  • Auxílio Creche ou Babá
  • Licença Paternidade estendida de 20 dias
  • Licença Maternidade de 180 dias, acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities


Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.


Profile


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
Preferably experience with Dataiku.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus


Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person’s singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent
Show more
